description:
Polished smooth cobblestone lines the road leading both north and south. To
the east the smooth white granite wall that surrounds the city reaches high
into the sky. Criss crossed with sparkling mineral veins, the wall stands at
least twenty feet tall. To the west is a large stone building, sounds of
merriment floating out of the windows. Above the door to the building is a
sign, "William the Braves Tavern". East Wall Road continues on to the north
and south.
name: Southern East Wall Road, before the Tavern
